flawed_nl_solution:
He needs 84 pounds of flour because 12 x 4 = <<12*4=84>>84
He needs 8.4 bags of 10 pound bags because 84 / 10 = <<84/10=8.4>>8.4
He spends $50 if he buys this flour because 5 x 10 = <<5*10=50>>50
He needs 4 bags of the 12-pound flour because 84 / 12 = <<84/12=7.0>>7.0
He would spend $52 on the 12-pound bags because 4 x 13 = 52
He spends $50 if he buys the cheapest flour because 50 < 52

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 48, not 84. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
